intro: Phanera finlaysoniana var. montana, commonly known as the Mexican red maple, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant red foliage, which turns brilliant shades of orange and red in the fall. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces small, clustered flowers in the spring, followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. This species thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats.
